meanings.sent1: I always carry my cedula in my wallet.
meanings.sent2: The security guard asked to see my cedula before letting me in.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally left my cedula at home and couldn't enter the building.
meanings.sent4: Her cedula was her ticket to access exclusive events.
meanings.sent5: The cedula with my photo on it helps prove my identity.

meanings.definition: A tax or fee imposed by the Spanish colonial government in the Philippines
meanings.sent1: The cedula was a burden on the local farmers.
meanings.sent2: People had to pay the cedula to the authorities every year.
meanings.sent3: The cedula seemed to grow larger every time tax season came around.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the cedula on the villagers' shoulders was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The cedula drained the villagers' resources and caused hardship.

meanings.definition: A certificate of residence in Spain
meanings.sent1: Obtaining a cedula was necessary for legal residency in Spain.
meanings.sent2: The cedula indicated that the person was a resident of Spain.
meanings.sent3: Carrying the cedula made him feel like a true Spaniard.
meanings.sent4: The cedula was a symbol of belonging in the Spanish community.
meanings.sent5: Her cedula proudly displayed her address in Spain.
